net.kuujo.vertigo

Class Vertigo

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.kuujo.vertigo.Vertigo

  • public final class Vertigo
extends Object
    The core Vertigo API.

    This is the primary interface for creating and deploying Vertigo networks.

    Vertigo provides its own cluster abstraction that allows cluster modes to be separated from network configurations. When deploying, undeploying, or otherwise operating on Vertigo networks, Vertigo will attempt to automatically detect and use the current Vert.x cluster state. See method documentation for more information.

    Author:
    Jordan Halterman

      • isDeployed

        public Vertigo isDeployed(NetworkConfig network,
                 org.vertx.java.core.Handler<org.vertx.java.core.AsyncResult<Boolean>> resultHandler)
        Checks whether a network is deployed in the cluster.

        Though a network configuration is provided to this method, the check only consists of checking the network named against current deployments. The structure of the given network configuration has no effect on the result.

        Parameters:
        network - The network to check.
        resultHandler - An asynchronous handler to be called with the result
        Returns:
        The Vertigo instance.
        See Also:
        isDeployed(String, Handler)

      • deployNetwork

        public Vertigo deployNetwork(String name)
        Deploys a bare network to the Vertigo cluster.

        This method will deploy an empty network to the current Vertigo cluster. The current cluster is determined by whether the Vert.x instance was deployed as a clustered Xync instance. If the current Vert.x cluster is a Xync backed cluster, the network will be deployed as a remote network. This means that any runtime configuration changes to the network will result in components being deployed on various nodes within the Vert.x cluster rather than within the current Vert.x instance.

        Parameters:
        name - The name of the network to deploy. If a network with the given name is already deployed in the current cluster then the deployment will simply have no effect.
        Returns:
        The Vertigo instance.
        See Also:
        deployNetwork(String, Handler), deployNetwork(NetworkConfig), deployNetwork(NetworkConfig, Handler)

      • deployNetwork

        public Vertigo deployNetwork(String name,
                    org.vertx.java.core.Handler<org.vertx.java.core.AsyncResult<ActiveNetwork>> doneHandler)
        Deploys a bare network to the Vertigo cluster.

        This method will deploy an empty network to the current Vertigo cluster. The current cluster is determined by whether the Vert.x instance was deployed as a clustered Xync instance. If the current Vert.x cluster is a Xync backed cluster, the network will be deployed as a remote network. This means that any runtime configuration changes to the network will result in components being deployed on various nodes within the Vert.x cluster rather than within the current Vert.x instance.

        Once the deployment is complete, an ActiveNetwork will be provided. The active network can be used to reconfigure the live network just like a normal network configuration. When active network configurations change, the live network is notified and asynchronously reconfigures itself to handle the configuration changes.

        Parameters:
        name - The name of the network to deploy. if a network with the given name is already deployed in the current cluster then the deployment will simply have no effect.
        doneHandler - An asynchronous handler to be called once complete.
        Returns:
        The Vertigo instance.
        See Also:
        deployNetwork(String), deployNetwork(NetworkConfig), deployNetwork(NetworkConfig, Handler)

      • deployNetwork

        public Vertigo deployNetwork(NetworkConfig network)
        Deploys a complete or partial network to the Vertigo cluster.

        If the given network's name matches the name of a network that's already running within the cluster then the configuration will be merged with the existing network's configuration. This allows components or connections to be added to existing networks by deploying separate configurations.

        If the network is not already running, Vertigo will resolve the network's cluster scope by evaluating the current Vert.x instance and the network configuration. If the current Vert.x instance is a clustered Xync instance then Vertigo will attempt to deploy the network as a clustered network. This means that components will be deployed on various nodes within the Vert.x cluster. This feature can be optionally overridden by specifying the cluster scope in the network configuration.

        If the current Vert.x instance is not a Xync clustered instance then all networks will fall back to local deployment.

        Parameters:
        network - The network configuration to deploy.
        Returns:
        The Vertigo instance.
        See Also:
        deployNetwork(String), deployNetwork(String, Handler), deployNetwork(NetworkConfig)

      • deployNetwork

        public Vertigo deployNetwork(NetworkConfig network,
                    org.vertx.java.core.Handler<org.vertx.java.core.AsyncResult<ActiveNetwork>> doneHandler)
        Deploys a complete or partial network to the Vertigo cluster.

        If the given network's name matches the name of a network that's already running within the cluster then the configuration will be merged with the existing network's configuration. This allows components or connections to be added to existing networks by deploying separate configurations.

        If the network is not already running, Vertigo will resolve the network's cluster scope by evaluating the current Vert.x instance and the network configuration. If the current Vert.x instance is a clustered Xync instance then Vertigo will attempt to deploy the network as a clustered network. This means that components will be deployed on various nodes within the Vert.x cluster. This feature can be optionally overridden by specifying the cluster scope in the network configuration.

        If the network is already running then the network configuration change will occur within the deployed network's cluster scope regardless of the given network configuration.

        If the current Vert.x instance is not a Xync clustered instance then all networks will fall back to local deployment.

        Once the deployment is complete, an ActiveNetwork will be provided. The active network can be used to reconfigure the live network just like a normal network configuration. When active network configurations change, the live network is notified and asynchronously reconfigures itself to handle the configuration changes.

        Parameters:
        network - The network configuration to deploy.
        doneHandler - An asynchronous handler to be called once complete. If the network is successfully deployed, the handler will be passed an ActiveNetwork which can be used to reconfigure the network asynchronously without shutdown.
        Returns:
        The Vertigo instance.
        See Also:
        deployNetwork(String), deployNetwork(String, Handler), deployNetwork(NetworkConfig)

      • undeployNetwork

        public Vertigo undeployNetwork(String name)
        Undeploys a complete network from the Vertigo cluster.

        The network will be undeployed in its entirety from the scope in which it is currently deployed.

        Parameters:
        name - The name of the network to undeploy.
        Returns:
        The Vertigo instance.
        See Also:
        undeployNetwork(String, Handler), undeployNetwork(NetworkConfig), undeployNetwork(NetworkConfig, Handler)

      • undeployNetwork

        public Vertigo undeployNetwork(String name,
                      org.vertx.java.core.Handler<org.vertx.java.core.AsyncResult<Void>> doneHandler)
        Undeploys a complete network from the Vertigo cluster.

        The network will be undeployed in its entirety from the scope in which it is currently deployed. If the network is not currently deployed then the undeployment will fail.

        Parameters:
        name - The name of the network to undeploy.
        doneHandler - An asynchronous handler to be called once complete.
        Returns:
        The Vertigo instance.
        See Also:
        undeployNetwork(String), undeployNetwork(NetworkConfig), undeployNetwork(NetworkConfig, Handler)

      • undeployNetwork

        public Vertigo undeployNetwork(NetworkConfig network)
        Undeploys a complete or partial network from the Vertigo cluster.

        The network will be undeployed from the scope in which it is currently deployed.

        If the configuration is a complete match to the configuration of the deployed network, the complete network will be undeployed. Alternatively, if the given configuration is only a partial configuration compared to the complete deployed configuration, only the components and connections defined in the given configuration will be undeployed from the running network. This allows the network to be asynchronously reconfigured without undeploying the network.

        Parameters:
        network - The network configuration to undeploy.
        Returns:
        The Vertigo instance.
        See Also:
        undeployNetwork(String), undeployNetwork(String, Handler), undeployNetwork(NetworkConfig, Handler)

      • undeployNetwork

        public Vertigo undeployNetwork(NetworkConfig network,
                      org.vertx.java.core.Handler<org.vertx.java.core.AsyncResult<Void>> doneHandler)
        Undeploys a complete or partial network from the Vertigo cluster.

        The network will be undeployed from the scope in which it is currently deployed. If the network is not currently deployed then the undeployment will fail.

        If the configuration is a complete match to the configuration of the deployed network, the complete network will be undeployed. Alternatively, if the given configuration is only a partial configuration compared to the complete deployed configuration, only the components and connections defined in the given configuration will be undeployed from the running network. This allows the network to be asynchronously reconfigured without undeploying the network.

        Parameters:
        network - The network configuration to undeploy.
        Returns:
        The Vertigo instance.
        See Also:
        undeployNetwork(String), undeployNetwork(String, Handler), undeployNetwork(NetworkConfig)
